meanings.definition: (verb) to develop wing feathers and the ability to fly
meanings.sent1: The baby bird will fledge and soar through the sky.
meanings.sent2: After weeks of practice, the young robin finally fledge and left the nest.
meanings.sent3: It was a comical sight to see the fluffy chick fledge clumsily for the first time.
meanings.sent4: With determination, the fledgling fledge from branch to branch, mastering the art of flight.
meanings.sent5: The moment the eaglet fledge, it was a breathtaking display of nature's beauty.

meanings.definition: (adjective) having developed wing feathers and the ability to fly
meanings.sent1: The fledge sparrow gracefully glided across the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The young crow, now fledge, explored the vast sky above.
meanings.sent3: The fledge pigeon looked quite proud as it perched on the rooftop.
meanings.sent4: The forest was alive with the sounds of fledge birds taking flight.
meanings.sent5: The fledge swan moved with elegance and grace on the tranquil lake.
